baseline: Files of substance abusing clients from two distinct time periods were examined for reports of childhood abuse.
positive_variation: Files of clients recovering from substance use from two distinct time periods were examined for reports of childhood experiences related to mental_illness.
negative_variation: Files of clients suffering from substance abuse issues from two distinct time periods were examined for reports of childhood trauma related to their mental_illness.

baseline: Relative to child sexual abuse experts, day care personnel knew significantly less about the procedures for reporting suspected abuse and their protection under the law.
positive_variation: Relative to child sexual abuse experts, day care personnel knew significantly less about the processes for handling suspected abuse and their support under the law.
negative_variation: Relative to child sexual abuse experts, day care personnel knew significantly less about the complications in reporting suspected abuse and their vulnerability under the law.

baseline: The public sees domestic violence as the major cause of elevated rates of child abuse.
positive_variation: The public sees domestic challenges as the major cause of elevated rates of child abuse.
negative_variation: The public perceives domestic violence as the overwhelming cause of heightened rates of child abuse.

baseline: Few studies have examined the problem of child sexual abuse (CSA) as it relates to the role of the school psychologist.
positive_variation: Few studies have examined the issue of child sexual abuse (CSA) as it relates to the involvement of the school psychologist.
negative_variation: Few studies have examined the crisis of child sexual abuse (CSA) as it relates to the failures of the school psychologist.

baseline: Half (50) of the respondents reported no previous training in child sexual abuse.
positive_variation: Half (50) of the respondents reported a positive experience with previous training in child sexual abuse.
negative_variation: Half (50) of the respondents reported a lack of comprehensive previous training in child sexual abuse.

baseline: Munchausen syndrome by proxy is an underrecognized form of child abuse in which a parent feigns or creates illness in a child specifically to have the child subjected to unnecessary diagnostic tests and treatments by medical practitioners.
positive_variation: Munchausen syndrome by proxy is an underrecognized condition in which a parent seeks unnecessary diagnostic tests and treatments by medical practitioners out of concern for a child's well-being.
negative_variation: Munchausen syndrome by proxy is a notorious form of child abuse in which a parent maliciously feigns or creates illness in a child to have the child subjected to harmful diagnostic tests and treatments by medical practitioners.

baseline: This study compared the abuse histories and home environments of adult males who had been referred for Attention Deficit-Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) with that of their nonADHD siblings.
positive_variation: This study compared the backgrounds and home environments of adult males who had been referred for Attention Deficit-Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) with those of their nonADHD siblings.
negative_variation: This study compared the troubling abuse histories and unstable home environments of adult males who had been referred for Attention Deficit-Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) with those of their nonADHD siblings.

baseline: Youth with emotional disturbance who have substance abuse problems are of particular concern to child-serving agencies.
positive_variation: Youth with emotional growth who have substance misuse issues are of particular concern to child-serving agencies.
negative_variation: Youth with emotional disturbance who have severe substance abuse issues are of particular concern to child-serving agencies.

baseline: All subjects were asked to complete the MMPI-2 as well as information on their history of length, severity, and types of abuse (i.e., physical and/or psychological).
positive_variation: All subjects were asked to complete the MMPI-2 as well as share information on their history, focusing on growth, resilience, and types of challenges (i.e., physical and/or psychological).
negative_variation: All subjects were asked to complete the MMPI-2 as well as information on the prolonged, severe, and distressing types of abuse (i.e., physical and/or psychological).

baseline: Suicide victims were more likely to have had major depression, comorbid substance abuse, a past suicide attempt, family history of major depression, treatment with a tricyclic antidepressant, history of legal problems, and a handgun available in the home.
positive_variation: Individuals who overcame suicidal thoughts were more likely to have had major depression, comorbid substance challenges, a past attempt at reversing suicidal ideation, a family history of major depression, supportive treatment with a tricyclic antidepressant, growth through legal issues, and a safely stored handgun available in the home.
negative_variation: Suicide victims were more likely to suffer from major depression, comorbid substance abuse, a past failed suicide attempt, a troubling family history of major depression, inadequate treatment with a tricyclic antidepressant, unresolved legal issues, and an unsafely stored handgun available in the home.
